title: England are close, but Eddie Jones must be frustrated they have not clicked at this Rugby World Cup
text:
England have gone one better than they did in the 2015 Rugby World Cup and made it out of their pool, yet they have not fired like many expected and unforced handling errors and penalties still hold them back.

Is there more to come or are the fractured performances so far as good as it gets?

We might find out in their next game against France but, as with previous games, a fractured performance might well suffice to beat a French team who have only shown moments of cogency. The fact is, as Wales have shown, you do not need to produce a performance that approaches perfection, you just need one that is better than your instant opponent. Against every side, bar probably New Zealand, that will be...
description: England have gone one better than they did in the 2015 Rugby World Cup and made it out of their pool, yet they have not fired like many expected and unforced handling errors and penalties still hold them back.
